You begin to build a ball of flame in your hands, ready to unleash it upon your enemies. Make a ranged spell attack roll against your targetâ€™s AC. On a success, you deal 3d6 fire damage. On a critical success, the target takes double damage and takes @Damage[(1*@item.level)d4[persistent,fire]] damage. The number of actions you spend when casting this spell determines the range and other parameters.

2 This spell has a range of 30 feet.

3 This spell has a range of 60 feet and deals half damage on a failure (but not a critical failure) as the ball of flame singes the target.

Two Rounds If you spend three actions Casting the Spell, you can avoid finishing the spell and spend another 3 actions on your next turn to empower the spell even further. If you do, after attacking the target, whether you hit or miss, the fireball explodes, dealing @Damage[(@item.rank*2)d6[fire]] damage to all other creatures in a @Template[emanation|distance:10] around the target (basic Reflex save). Additionally, you are surrounded with roaring flames for 1 minute, dealing @Damage[(@item.rank)[fire]] damage to creatures that Grab you or that hit you with an unarmed Strike or a non-reach melee weapon.

Heightened (+1) The initial damage on a hit, as well as the burst damage for two-round casting time, each increase by 2d6, the persistent damage increases by 1d4, and the damage creatures take if they Grapple or hit you while you're surrounded by the roaring flames increases by 1.
